sentences.sContent: In this particular case, no one else was involved.
sentences.sCn: 这件事没有其他人牵涉其中。

sentences.sContent: Most students choose one particular area for research.
sentences.sCn: 大多数学生选择一个特定领域进行研究。

sentences.sContent: Marty’s very particular about his food.
...has reorganised its medical staff into teams to focus on particular treatment areas; consultants...
...or is here something of particular value about curiosity in and of itself...
...You have to get across what it is about a particular area that has inspired you...
...I had come to the developers' conference partly because I hoped that this particular set of parents...
...and in particular postgraduate students Who are so important to the UKs research output...
...and such training is more important than any particular major in a liberal arts college...
...the man who runs the class will go though some particular part of the car...
...What I thought I was writing on was to talk about what particular sport means to me when I participate in...
...the most user-friendly or the most reliable products in a particular field...
...But it does not really explain how children come to use language in particular ways...

synos.tran: 特别的；详细的；独有的；挑剔的

phrases.pCn: 过分讲究的；难以取悦的
在一切方面；每一项；每一点

words.tran: 特别地，独特地；详细地，具体地；明确地，细致地
特殊神宠论；完全忠于一种理论

trans.tranCn: 特别的，特指的；讲究的；挑剔的，吹毛求疵的
trans.tranOther: a particular thing or person is the one that you are talking about, and not any other
